melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: He Himself is the Word of the Shabad, and He Himself is the Insignia.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: He Himself is the Listener, and He Himself is the Knower.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: He Himself created the creation, and He Himself beholds His almighty power.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. translation.text: You are the Great Giver; Your Name alone is approved. ||1||

translation.text: Such is the Name of the Immaculate, Divine Lord.

text: ਹਉ ਜਾਚਿਕੁ ਤੂ ਅਲਖ ਅਭੇਉ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: I am just a beggar; You are invisible and unknowable. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: hau jāchik tū alakh abhēu .1. rahāu .

text: ਮਾਇਆ ਮੋਹੁ ਧਰਕਟੀ ਨਾਰਿ ॥ ਭੂੰਡੀ ਕਾਮਣਿ ਕਾਮਣਿਆਰਿ ॥

translation.text: Love of Maya is like a cursed woman, ugly, dirty and promiscuous.

transliteration.text: māiā mōh dharakatī nār . bhūndī kāman kāmaniār .

translation.text: Power and beauty are false, and last for only a few days.

translation.text: But when one is blessed with the Naam, the darkness within is illuminated. ||2||

translation.text: I tasted Maya and renounced it, and now, I have no doubts.

text: ਸਬਦਿ ਮੁਏ ਮਨੁ ਮਨ ਤੇ ਮਾਰਿਆ ॥

translation.text: One who dies in the Word of the Shabad conquers his mind, through his mind.

transliteration.text: sabad muē man man tē māriā .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. translation.text: Keeping his mind restrained, he enshrines the True Lord within his heart.

text: ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਸੂਝੈ ਗੁਰ ਕਉ ਵਾਰਿਆ ॥

translation.text: He does not know any other, and he is a sacrifice to the Guru.

transliteration.text: avar n sūjhai gur kau vāriā .
